adjective.description: Of the nature of, or resembling, a pale or stake. Now chiefly (Zoology and Palaeontology): of or relating to the pali of a coral.

origin: Late 17th century; earliest use found in John Gibbon (1629–1718), herald. From classical Latin pālāris consisting of or involving stakes from pālus + -āris<br>1950s; earliest use found in Thomas Southwood (b. 1931). From pala + -ar.
